description: The following is a general procedure guide for preparation and staining of formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tissues using a purified, unconjugated primary antibody, biotinylated secondary antibody and streptavidin-horseradish peroxidase (Sav-HRP) and DAB detection system. Because each antigen differs in terms of requirement for fixation, amplification step, etc., it is not possible to write an inclusive protocol that will work for all antigens. The user must determine optimal conditions for each antigen of interest. Many protocols for staining individual antigens, as well as useful tips and troubleshooting guides for immunohistochemistry, can be found at the IHC World web site (http://www.ihcworld.com/).
warning:
Formalin is a suspect carcinogen. It can cause eye, skin, and respiratory tract irritation. It should be handled in a hood.

 

DAB is a suspect carcinogen. Handle with care. Wear gloves, lab coat and eye protection.

components.data: Fix freshly dissected tissue (<3mm thick) with 10% formalin or other fixatives for 24-48 h at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fix freshly dissected tissue (<3mm thick) with 10% formalin or other fixatives for 24-48 h at room temperature.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Immunohistochemistry Protocol for Paraffin-Embedded Sections
source_data.annotation: (Caution: Formalin is a suspect carcinogen. It can cause eye, skin, and respiratory tract irritation. It should be handled in a hood.)
source_data.thread_text: (Caution: Formalin is a suspect carcinogen. It can cause eye, skin, and respiratory tract irritation. It should be handled in a hood.)
source_data.body: (Caution: Formalin is a suspect carcinogen. It can cause eye, skin, and respiratory tract irritation. It should be handled in a hood.)

components.data: Rinse the tissue with running tap water for 1 h.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse the tissue with running tap water for 1 h.
Dehydrate the tissue through 70% alcohol, 45 min.

components.data: Clear the tissue through a change of xylene, 1 h. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Clear the tissue through a change of xylene, 1 h. (1/2)

components.data: Immerse the tissue in a change of paraffin, 1 h. (1/3)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immerse the tissue in a change of paraffin, 1 h. (1/3)

components.data: Embed the tissue in a paraffin block.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Embed the tissue in a paraffin block.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 6 of Immunohistochemistry Protocol for Paraffin-Embedded Sections
source_data.annotation: The paraffin tissue block can be stored at room temperature for years.
source_data.thread_text: The paraffin tissue block can be stored at room temperature for years.
source_data.body: The paraffin tissue block can be stored at room temperature for years.

components.data: Section the paraffin-embedded tissue block at 5-8 µm thickness on a microtome and float in a 40°C water bath containing distilled water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Section the paraffin-embedded tissue block at 5-8 µm thickness on a microtome and float in a 40°C water bath containing distilled water.

components.data: Transfer the sections onto glass slides suitable for immunohistochemistry (e.g. Superfrost Plus). Allow the slides to dry overnight and store slides at room temperature until ready for use.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the sections onto glass slides suitable for immunohistochemistry (e.g. Superfrost Plus). Allow the slides to dry overnight and store slides at room temperature until ready for use.

components.data: Deparaffinize slides in a change of xylene, 5 min. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Deparaffinize slides in a change of xylene, 5 min. (1/2)

components.data: Drain off the blocking buffer from the slides.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Drain off the blocking buffer from the slides.

components.data: Transfer slides to 100% alcohol, for a 3-minute change. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer slides to 100% alcohol, for a 3-minute change. (1/2)

components.data: Block endogenous peroxidase activity by incubating sections in 3% H2O2 solution in methanol at room temperature for 10 min to block endogenous peroxidase activity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Block endogenous peroxidase activity by incubating sections in 3% H2O2 solution in methanol at room temperature for 10 min to block endogenous peroxidase activity.

components.data: Change by rinsing in 300 ml of PBS, for 5 min. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Change by rinsing in 300 ml of PBS, for 5 min. (1/2)

components.data: (optional) Perform antigen retrieval to unmask the antigenic epitope. The most commonly used antigen retrieval is a citrate buffer method. Arrange the slides in a staining container. Pour 300 ml of 10 mM citrate buffer, pH 6.0 into the staining container and incubate it at 95-100°C for 10 min (optimal incubation time should be determined by user). Remove the staining container to room temperature and allow the slides to cool for 20 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: (optional) Perform antigen retrieval to unmask the antigenic epitope. The most commonly used antigen retrieval is a citrate buffer method. Arrange the slides in a staining container. Pour 300 ml of 10 mM citrate buffer, pH 6.0 into the staining container and incubate it at 95-100°C for 10 min (optimal incubation time should be determined by user). Remove the staining container to room temperature and allow the slides to cool for 20 min.

components.data: Change by rinsing slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Change by rinsing slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)

components.data: (optional) Add 100 µl blocking buffer (e.g. 10% fetal bovine serum in PBS) onto the sections of the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 1h.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: (optional) Add 100 µl blocking buffer (e.g. 10% fetal bovine serum in PBS) onto the sections of the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 1h.

components.data: Apply 100 µl appropriately diluted primary antibody (in antibody dilution buffer, e.g. 0.5% bovine serum albumin in PBS) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 1 h.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply 100 µl appropriately diluted primary antibody (in antibody dilution buffer, e.g. 0.5% bovine serum albumin in PBS) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 1 h.

components.data: Change by washing the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Change by washing the slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)

components.data: Apply 100 µl appropriately diluted biotinylated secondary antibody (using the antibody dilution buffer) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply 100 µl appropriately diluted biotinylated secondary antibody (using the antibody dilution buffer) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 30 min.

components.data: Change by washing slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Change by washing slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)

components.data: Apply 100 µl appropriately diluted Sav-HRP conjugates (using the antibody dilution buffer) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 30 min (keep protected from light).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply 100 µl appropriately diluted Sav-HRP conjugates (using the antibody dilution buffer) to the sections on the slides and incubate in a humidified chamber at room temperature for 30 min (keep protected from light).

components.data: Change by washing slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Change by washing slides in 300 ml PBS for 5 min. (1/2)

components.data: Apply 100 µl DAB substrate solution (freshly made just before use: 0.05% DAB - 0.015% H2O2 in PBS) to the sections on the slides to reveal the color of antibody staining. Allow the color development for < 5 min until the desired color intensity is reached.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Apply 100 µl DAB substrate solution (freshly made just before use: 0.05% DAB - 0.015% H2O2 in PBS) to the sections on the slides to reveal the color of antibody staining. Allow the color development for < 5 min until the desired color intensity is reached.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 23 of Immunohistochemistry Protocol for Paraffin-Embedded Sections

components.data: Change by washing slides in 300 ml PBS for 2 min. (1/3)

source_data.description: Change by washing slides in 300 ml PBS for 2 min. (1/3)

components.data: (optional) Counterstain slides by immersing sides in Hematoxylin (e.g. Gill’s Hematoxylin) for 1-2 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: (optional) Counterstain slides by immersing sides in Hematoxylin (e.g. Gill’s Hematoxylin) for 1-2 min.

components.data: Rinse the slides in running tap water for > 15 min.
components.name: Description
